The only entities that can define Bitcoin on behalf of others are custodians of bitcoin; the users who entrust their money to a third party also hand over control of deciding which rules comprise the network to which they agree to use.
I'd say it's pretty clear that consensus is BTC == Bitcoin, though there aren't any metrics that form a definition. Metrics can merely hint at where the consensus lies.
You may define what Bitcoin is to yourself. You may not define what Bitcoin is to others without their consent.pic.twitter.com/6vVRhoVTZm
